content.description: A battery with <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll"> <mi>emf</mi> </math> <math alttext="1.5 volts" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math> and internal resistance <math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is connected to a resistor of resistance <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The current in the circuit is <math alttext="0.50 amp" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math>. When an identical battery is added to the circuit in series, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the current in the circuit is <math alttext="0.75 amp" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.75</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math>.
content.question: Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> and <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is very small compared to <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>.
<math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is very large compared to <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>.
<math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is equal to <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>.
<math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> and <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> are comparable in magnitude, but they are not equal.

content.answer: <math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> and <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> are comparable in magnitude, but they are not equal.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
